title: Leafy Loop Walk Durrow Route

images.title: kevin higgins / Riverside walk
images.caption: Riverside walk. Riverside walk 'Leafy Loops' walking route on bank of River Nore near Durrow.

images.title: The Square by kevin higgins, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Square in Durrow. The village takes its name from the Irish Darmhagh Ua nDuach (meaning 'the oak plain [in the territory] of Ui Duach'). It is in a civil parish of the same name.

images.title: Overgrown Lime Kiln by kevin higgins, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Overgrown Lime Kiln

images.caption: River and Reeds

images.title: Joseph Mischyshyn / Durrow - River Erkina & N8 bridge
images.caption: River Erkina bridge in the town. The river is a tributary of the River Nore. It flows north towards Rathdowney and then turns east in the direction of Durrow entering the River Nore around 1.5 km east of the town.

images.title: Mid Ireland Tourism, CC BY 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Durrow Scarecrow Festival 2013. Durrow's "Scarecrow Festival" takes place during the summer, and involves people from the area making their own scarecrows. The festival first took place in 2009, and was nominated for "Best Festival of 2012 and 2013" in the Irish Times Ticket Awards. The event includes Live Music, Food & Entertainment including a Scarecrow Maze, Europe's Largest Mega Slide, Bouncy Castles, Scarecrow Trail, Historic Walks, Dog Friendly Events, Laser Tag, Sensory Area, Workshops, Face Painting, Pony & Trap rides, Craft Fair and a search to find Wally Scarecrow, whose location changes every day

description: This circular walk follows the Leafy Loop trail in Durrow, County Laois. The waymarked footpath is one of the Irish National Looped Walks. On the way there are some lovely views of the Durrow Valley, peaceful woodland trails and fine waterside sections along the River Nore which runs through the area. To continue your walking you could head south to visit the city of Kilkenny where you can try the Kilkenny River and Canal Walk. The easy waterside walk also takes you past the 12th century castle with its lovely grounds and gardens. You can also pick up the waymarked Nore Valley Walk which starts in the city.
display_address: Durrow Wood, L1650, Durrow ED, The Municipal District of Borris-in-Ossory — Mountmellick, County Laois, Leinster, R32 YY38, Éire / Ireland
